intro: Hieracium alpestre, commonly known as alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to reddish-orange in color. Hieracium alpestre is known for its ability to form dense colonies, often serving as an indicator of disturbed or nutrient-poor soils.
